content:
I got different results, but couldn't find any bug in my code, so I finally checked your sample solution. 
I don't understand your line 46: You invoke cos with (lat+missile_lat)/2, but cos() expects radian and your variables are in degrees.
If I delete a deg2rad() call from my solution, then I also pass all tests, but I think this is wrong.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Tedious but original and fun, and easy enough for beginners

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: I feel like the puzzle lore really is stupid, but well, that doesn't matter, funny enough to me.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good work, the contribution is fun and contains a lot of play on words. The easy category is the good one, because there is no computing difficulty, the real difficulty here is to read the statement, the corresponding tag is the most important.
The errors I found have been corrected, there is no more to say. Congratulations for your first contribution !

The distance between Earth and Moon is not 385km but 385 000 km
https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Distance_lunaire
But I guess it doesn't matter here ^^

In the goal section, you said you give longitude and latitude, and in the input section, you say it is latitude and longitude.
Can you write it in the same order ? (the real given order)

"1g speed" is not really exact, because g is an acceleration : 9,81m/sÂ². I think you should mention the speed without talking about g.

When is the minuteman missile launched by the Earth ? As soon as the spaceship is in the range (altitude 160km) or when it stops Ã  500m above the ground ? => Sorry, the answer is already in the statement.

Do the USA launch the missile only if the alien's target is in USA, or do they protect every countries ?

(I want to approve your contribution, because you did a good work, but I need to solve it before)

Goal section
* paragraph 5: Please change "knowing" to "given".

Input section
* For consistency, please change:
  â€¢ "n" => "N"
  â€¢ "lat" => "latitude"
  â€¢ "lon" => "longitude"

Output section
* Please add "For each mission," between "N lines:" and "the output".

* Suggest to delete "only".

Constraints section
* Please move the entire paragraph to Goal section, because it it is explanation of the rules, rather than a constraint on possible inputs.

* Please mention "[[latitude]] is always in {{N}}."

* Please mention "[[longitude]] is always in {{W}}."

Cases
* Suggest to redistribute the cases within:
  â€¢ "Those missions are stupid" (Test) and "This is a polar bear, not a cow !" (Validator)
  â€¢ "Union of Steak Amateurs" (Test) and "Union of Steak Amateurs" (Validator)
  so that the output of "impossible" is required in both the test and the validator in each pair.

Stub generator
* The variable names used here are different from those used in the other sections. Please revise the names here or in the other sections for consistency.

Thanks.

Hi my dude,
Thanks for the detailed review ! I did as you advise :D
One exception : the suggestion on ---Those missions are stupid" (Test) and "This is a polar bear, not a cow !" (Validator)--- because those tests have a logic (all destinations exist !) and there is no ice with a cow farm on it close enough to California...

1. Thanks for spotting the mistake, i fixed it ^^
2. latitude then longitude, similarly, i fixed it
3. Right, i should be more "physics accurate", i fixed it.

5. The program defends all North America. I added a constant format to the place where it is said. North America includes Canada, Mexico and USA, there is no case where no missile is sent.

Thanks for the feedback :)
Merci RÃ©mi :)

It was made to be funny, but still kind of believable, so i'll say it's a win ;)
P.S.: check on many of the quoted events, places, and organisations, i invented nothing except the alien ones :D
Thanks :)

Hi TBali, Thanks for your interest :)
You are absolutely right. Mistake which survived the whole process of contribution...
I found out that some distances were quite odd while testing the farm-to-silo distances, but forgot to check on the issue later, while continuing on the statement. I should have noted it.
This is fixed now (mistake, testcases, and validators). Let me know if there is still a problem !
Thx for the quick fix! Now I also pass after I put back the deg2rad conversion.
Perfect, as it was supposed to be. Thanks to you !

Still miss one detail. The statement doesn't say how to choose between collectors when several are possible.
Seeing your solution, I guess I have to choose the bigger one, you have to write it in the statement. Because we could imagine that we can choose the one maximizing the value (nbCows - cost).

When you compute the distance (line 47) why do you use the collector's altitude ? You should use the Space Force Base's altitude (which is not given !)

(I'm still debugging because I don't find the same results as you)

I think there is a mistake in your code, (or maybe I did'nt understand something).
Line 51 :
abduction_time=collector_altitude*1000/(g*g_param[cs]);

I think you should use collector_abduction_altitude (500m) instead of collector_altitude, because the cow aren't at the altitude 0 but at the ground altitude..

Hi again !
1. About collectors : you have to send the one which will bring the more cows, but staying profitable. For example, if a {{Cow harvester}} can bring 11 cows and a {{Land MoWer}} 7 cows, you will sendthe Land Mower, even if it is smaller, because it is the biggest profitable collector to send. Is it not clear ? Should i change the statement ? I could provide examples.
2. Totally true ! My bad. I am changing this right away. It doesn't change the testcases and validators. -(missile_maxalt-missile_alt)-
3. right, it is a mistake. {{abduction_time}} depends on the {{collector_abduction_altitude}}. testcases and validators have been corrected accordingly.
My solution disappears, I have to write all from the beginning :'(

Writing a new solution ... about collectors, I think you should change the statement so that we know exactly what to do if there are more than one possible to send. I understand your criteria, but since there can be other criterias you should specify.

I think you inverted your collector_speed vector ^^
It is the last thing, because if I invert too I got the same results as yours.
I'm ready to approve, I just need to see this point fixed, and the statement updated with how you choose the collector when we can send several.

You tricked me on test "those missions are stupid", I was looking at coordinates by find_first_of("123456789") !

Thank you to be there ! I indeed inverted the values. I modified the solution, and the testcases and validators, again.
For the collectors, I edited the statement, adding some examples, tell me if this is enough.

I'm happy that you managed to make it work, and thank you for the detailed questions. My submission is now correct, thanks to you :)
And i reached the limit of characters in almost every category wops :)
I don't understand your example : "If a L4nd Mower can get 7 cows and a VaCoWM 3 cows, then you must send the last one.". I thought it was the contrary ?

No, because of the "profits" problem.
Sending a Land MoWer is not profitable if he doesn't bring back 6 or more cows. I'm modifying the statement again. (I indeed did a typo, its 6 cows the limit for land mowers, not 8 )
Thanks, everything is Ok now.

Thank you for making the changes!

OK, I now understand your logic. It just seems that there are so few validators which require "impossible" as the output.

Another matter: as the tags will appear under "What you learned" section, so having "I Love Cows" as a tag seems a bit odd here ðŸ˜…

this is actuzlly intentional ^^ this platform for me should not forget the "fun" part of coding :D
If you telll me it is a real problem, i will remove it though ^^

Well, most of the existing tags are normal, but there are a few that aren't... So, I won't say your tag is a real problem, but I guess it's better to keep the number of such tags to a minimum :wink:

Reference: https://chadok.info/codingame/tags_list.html
So i should remove this one ? No problem. Do you think antoher tag is irrelevant ?
Just that one :)

Hi,

I just spotted two typos around the 4th paragraph of the statement:
* atitude => altitude
* immediatly => immediately

I also spotted that the efficiency of VaCoWM Cleaner in the statement (0.85) is different from that used in your code (0.8).

Thanks.

Thanks, i'll fix that immediately. You rock :)
Actually, for"immediately" i thought it was the way to write it, my bad
I've increased the difficulty from Easy to Medium in view of the low community success ratio (solved by 121 out of 453, or 26.71%).
